Based on my analysis, here's what we need to do to create the album page:

1. Create a new view component `AlbumView.vue` in the `src/views` directory
2. Add a new route in `router/index.js` for the album page
3. Modify `AlbumItem.vue` to make the album name clickable and navigate to the album page
4. Use the existing `getAlbum` and `getAlbumTracks` API functions to fetch the album details

Here's the detailed plan:

1. First, we'll create the new `AlbumView.vue` component that will:
   - Display a large album cover image
   - Show album metadata (name, artist, release date)
   - List all tracks with their durations
   - Use the existing styling patterns from your app
   - Handle loading states and errors

2. We'll add a new route `/album/:id` in the router configuration

3. We'll modify the `AlbumItem.vue` component to:
   - Make the album name clickable
   - Add a navigation function to the album page
   - Keep the existing LastFM link functionality

Would you like me to proceed with implementing these changes? Please let me know if you want me to make any adjustments to this plan before we start.

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,81 @@
- 
+ &lt;script setup&gt;
+ import { ref, onMounted } from 'vue';
+ import { useRoute } from 'vue-router';
+ import { getAlbum, getAlbumTracks } from '../utils/api';
+ 
+ const route = useRoute();
+ const album = ref(null);
+ const tracks = ref(null);
+ const loading = ref(true);
+ const error = ref(null);
+ 
+ const formatDuration = (ms) =&gt; {
+   const minutes = Math.floor(ms / 60000);
+   const seconds = Math.floor((ms % 60000) / 1000);
+   return &#96;${minutes}:${seconds.toString().padStart(2, '0')}&#96;;
+ };
+ 
+ onMounted(async () =&gt; {
+   try {
+     loading.value = true;
+     const albumId = route.params.id;
+     const [albumData, tracksData] = await Promise.all([
+       getAlbum(localStorage.getItem('token'), albumId),
+       getAlbumTracks(albumId)
+     ]);
+     album.value = albumData;
+     tracks.value = tracksData.items;
+   } catch (err) {
+     error.value = 'Failed to load album details';
+     console.error(err);
+   } finally {
+     loading.value = false;
+   }
+ });
+ &lt;/script&gt;
+ 
+ &lt;template&gt;
+   &lt;div class="container mx-auto px-4 py-8"&gt;
+     &lt;div v-if="loading" class="text-center"&gt;
+       &lt;p class="text-delft-blue text-lg"&gt;Loading album details...&lt;/p&gt;
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+     
+     &lt;div v-else-if="error" class="text-center"&gt;
+       &lt;p class="text-red-500 text-lg"&gt;{{ error }}&lt;/p&gt;
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+ 
+     &lt;div v-else class="max-w-4xl mx-auto"&gt;
+       &lt;div class="flex flex-col md:flex-row gap-8"&gt;
+         &lt;!-- Album Cover --&gt;
+         &lt;div class="md:w-1/2"&gt;
+           &lt;img 
+             :src="album.images[0].url" 
+             :alt="album.name"
+             class="w-full rounded-xl shadow-lg"
+           /&gt;
+         &lt;/div&gt;
+ 
+         &lt;!-- Album Info --&gt;
+         &lt;div class="md:w-1/2"&gt;
+           &lt;h1 class="text-3xl font-bold text-delft-blue mb-2"&gt;{{ album.name }}&lt;/h1&gt;
+           &lt;p class="text-xl text-delft-blue mb-4"&gt;{{ album.artists[0].name }}&lt;/p&gt;
+           &lt;p class="text-mindero mb-6"&gt;{{ album.release_date.substring(0, 4) }}&lt;/p&gt;
+           
+           &lt;div class="bg-mindero rounded-xl p-4"&gt;
+             &lt;h2 class="text-xl font-bold text-delft-blue mb-4"&gt;Track List&lt;/h2&gt;
+             &lt;ul class="space-y-2"&gt;
+               &lt;li 
+                 v-for="track in tracks" 
+                 :key="track.id"
+                 class="flex justify-between items-center text-delft-blue"
+               &gt;
+                 &lt;span class="flex-1"&gt;{{ track.name }}&lt;/span&gt;
+                 &lt;span class="ml-4"&gt;{{ formatDuration(track.duration_ms) }}&lt;/span&gt;
+               &lt;/li&gt;
+             &lt;/ul&gt;
+           &lt;/div&gt;
+         &lt;/div&gt;
+       &lt;/div&gt;
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+   &lt;/div&gt;
+ &lt;/template&gt;
```

_**User (2025-03-31 22:30Z)**_

is there a max on track retrival api? 20 tracks?

---

_**Agent (mode Agent)**_

Let me check the Spotify API documentation and our current implementation.

Looking at the Spotify API documentation, the `/v1/albums/{id}/tracks` endpoint has a default limit of 20 tracks per request, but it supports pagination with a maximum of 50 tracks per request. We should modify our code to handle pagination for albums with more than 50 tracks.

Let me update the code to handle this:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="edit_file">

<details><summary>Tool use: **edit_file** • Edit file: src/views/AlbumView.vue</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 1, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -7,5 +7,5 @@
  const router = useRouter();
  const album = ref(null);
- const tracks = ref(null);
+ const tracks = ref([]);
  const loading = ref(true);
  const error = ref(null);
```

**Chunk 2**
Lines added: 19, lines removed: undefined

```diff
@@ -16,4 +16,23 @@
    return &#96;${minutes}:${seconds.toString().padStart(2, '0')}&#96;;
  };
+ 
+ const fetchAllTracks = async (albumId) =&gt; {
+   let allTracks = [];
+   let offset = 0;
+   const limit = 50; // Maximum allowed by Spotify API
+   
+   while (true) {
+     const response = await getAlbumTracks(albumId, limit, offset);
+     allTracks = [...allTracks, ...response.items];
+     
+     if (response.items.length &lt; limit) {
+       break; // No more tracks to fetch
+     }
+     
+     offset += limit;
+   }
+   
+   return allTracks;
+ };
  
  onMounted(async () =&gt; {
```

**Chunk 3**
Lines added: 2, lines removed: 2

```diff
@@ -23,8 +42,8 @@
      const [albumData, tracksData] = await Promise.all([
        getAlbum(localStorage.getItem('token'), albumId),
-       getAlbumTracks(albumId)
+       fetchAllTracks(albumId)
      ]);
      album.value = albumData;
-     tracks.value = tracksData.items;
+     tracks.value = tracksData;
    } catch (err) {
      error.value = 'Failed to load album details';
```

</details>

</tool-use>

---

Now I need to update the API function to support pagination:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="edit_file">

<details><summary>Tool use: **edit_file** • Edit file: src/utils/api.js</summary>

---

I've made the following changes to handle albums with more than 50 tracks:

1. Updated the `getAlbumTracks` API function to:
   - Accept `limit` and `offset` parameters
   - Default to 50 tracks per request (Spotify's maximum)
   - Include pagination parameters in the API request

2. Added a new `fetchAllTracks` function in AlbumView that:
   - Fetches tracks in batches of 50
   - Continues fetching until all tracks are retrieved
   - Combines all tracks into a single array

3. Modified the component to:
   - Initialize tracks as an empty array
   - Use the new `fetchAllTracks` function
   - Handle the complete track list

Now the album view will show all tracks, even for albums with more than 50 tracks. Would you like me to make any adjustments to this implementation?

---
